tracer.paths

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • tracer.paths.Path
      • tracer.paths.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants, Drawable

    public class Line
extends Path
    A line in 2D space.
    Author:
    James Morrow [jamesmorrowdesign.com]

      • trace

        public void trace(Point target,
                  float u)
        Description copied from class: Path
        Given a 1D coordinate, a float, maps the coordinate to a 2D coordinate and stores it in a given Point.

        Maps a given floating point number within [0, 1) to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Specified by:
        trace in class Path
        Parameters:
        target - The Point in which the result is stored.
        u - A number within [0, 1)

      • trace

        public static void trace(Point target,
                         Point a,
                         Point b,
                         float u)
        Interpolates between the line defined by (a.x, a.y) and (b.x, b.y) by the given amount (a value between 0 and 1) and stores the result in the given point.
        Parameters:
        target - The point in which to store the result
        a - The first point
        b - The second point
        u - The amount by which to interpolate (a value within [0, 1))

      • trace

                         float ax,
                         float ay,
                         float bx,
                         float by,
                         float u)
        Interpolates between the line defined by (ax, ay) and (bx, by) by the given amount (a value between 0 and 1) and stores the result in the given point.
        Parameters:
        pt - the point
        ax - the x-coordinate of the first point
        ay - the y-coordinate of the first point
        bx - the x-coordinate of the second point
        by - the y-coordinate of the second point
        u - the amount by which to interpolate (a value within [0, 1))

        public static boolean touches(float ax,
                              float ay,
                              float bx,
                              float by,
                              float x,
                              float y)
        Returns true if the given point comes in close enough contact with the line.
        Parameters:
        ax - the x-coordinate of the first point
        ay - the y-coordinate of the first point
        bx - the x-coordinate of the second point
        by - the y-coordinate of the second point
        x - the x of the point
        y - the y of the point
        Returns:

      • touches

        public static boolean touches(float ax,
                              float ay,
                              float bx,
                              float by,
                              float x,
                              float y,
                              float intersectRadius)
        Returns true if the line defined by (ax, ay) and (bx, by) comes within the given radius to any point in the line.
        Parameters:
        ax - the x-coordinate of the first point
        ay - the y-coordinate of the second point
        bx - the x-coordinate of the first point
        by - the y-coordinate of the second point
        x - the x of the point
        y - the y of the point
        intersectRadius - the maximum distance that can be considered touching
        Returns:
        true if the point touches the line and false otherwise

      • getGap

        public float getGap(int i)
        Description copied from class: Path
        Gives the ith discontinuity in the Path as a 1D coordinate. Gaps should be unique and indexed in ascending order. In other words, this must hold true: gap(i) < gap(i+1) as i varies from 0 to getGapCount()-1. Gives -1 if the index is valid.
        Specified by:
        getGap in class Path
        Parameters:
        i - The index
        Returns:
        The ith discontinuity as a value within [0, 1)
